brainly_data.question:
In Oedipus the king, how does the setting most affect the development of the plot?

A.by downplaying the ironic importance of the palace of Thebes while Oedipus remains unaware of his true identity

B.by utilizing the Chorus to clarify that Oedipus’s central conflict is affected by an annual oracle from the gods

C.by employing foreshadowing techniques to illuminate the timing of Oedipus’s self-revelation

D.by retelling the familiar story of the hero, Oedipus, but changing the location of the tale to provide objective distance
brainly_data.subject: English
